links.title: Tesla dialed back Model 3 parts orders by 40%, says Taiwan supplier
links.description: Hota Industrial Manufacturing Co, a Taiwanese automotive components maker and long time parts supplier for Tesla, has reportedly been told to dial back its production of Model 3 components from 5,000 units per week in December to 3,000 per week. links.title: Tesla fans: Study Ford's China joint venture very carefully - DailyKanban
links.description: Hopping on the Chinese EV bandwagon, and trying to comply with looming tough EV mandates in China, U.S. carmaker Ford has signed a joint venture agreement with Zotye Auto to make low-cost electric cars in China. Investors in Californian carmaker Tesla should closely study this agreement.

messages.body: $TSLA Humans to blame for global warming, massive federal government report says https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2017/11/03/humans-blame-global-warming-massive-federal-government-report-says/829783001/

links.title: Humans to blame for global warming, massive federal government report says
links.description: Climate change is real, it's here and we're the cause of it, according to the USA's most comprehensive climate science report ever produced. With the planet the warmest it's been in the history of modern civilization, the federal government said Friday that "it's extremely likely that human activities, especially emissions of greenhouse gases, are the dominant cause of the observed warming since the mid-20th century."

messages.body: $TSLA per link https://seekingalpha.com/article/4123039-tesla-buys-supplier-talent-buy-troubleshoot-model-3-ramp brought Perbix for 34,772 shares for about 10 M = 288/share ??

links.title: Tesla Buys Supplier: Talent Buy To Troubleshoot Model 3 Ramp?
links.description: In an unusual transaction, after the market closed on Monday, news agencies started reporting that Tesla ( TSLA) acquired a Minneapolis-based supplier named Perbix. "Tesla Motors Inc. is buying Perbix, a Brooklyn Park company that has been selling factory automation equipment and ideas to the fast-growing automaker for about three years."
